books.name: The Great Gatsby
books.description: The story primarily concerns the young and mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby and his quixotic passion and obsession with the beautiful former debutante Daisy Buchanan.

books.name: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.description: The novel explores the irrationality of adult attitudes toward race and class in the Deep South of the 1930s.
A dystopian social science fiction novel and cautionary tale written by George Orwell.

books.name: The Catcher in the Rye
books.description: A story of Holden Caulfield, a teenager from New York City, who is expelled from his high school and goes on an aimless journey.

books.name: Pride and Prejudice
books.description: Follows the main character Elizabeth Bennet as she deals with issues of manners, upbringing, morality, education, and marriage in the society of the landed gentry of early 19th-century England.
